(8/8) #AadharVerdict deciphered. -Concern 8: mandating linking of Aadhaar with bank accounts unconstitutional. -SC’s view: The provision in the present form violates the right to privacy of a person which extends to banking details.

(7/8) #AadharVerdict deciphered. -Concern 7: Wrong to pass Aadhaar bill as ‘money bill’ -SC’s view: section 7 of Aadhaar act has the elements of ‘money bill’. Welfare measures to poor, paid by consolidated fund of India, it is validly passed as money bill.

(6/8) #AadharVerdict deciphered. -Concern 6: Authentication failure could lead to a denial of benefits to the needy. -SC’c view: Biometric accuracy is 99.76%, if shelved 99.76% would suffer. 0.232% failure shouldn’t be excuse for reverting to system of leakages, pilferages.

(5/8) #AadharVerdict deciphered. -Concern 5: sharing of Aadhaar data with private entity is susceptible to misuse. -SC’s view: sharing data with private entity may establish identity of an individual ‘for any purpose’. Would enable commercial exploitation of an individual.

(4/8) #AadharVerdict deciphered. -Concern 4: Aadhaar project creates or has tendency to create surveillance state. -SC’s view: Very difficult to create profile of a person simply on the basis of biometric and demographic info & thereby creating a surveillance state.

(3/8) #AadharVerdict deciphered. -Concern 3: Aadhaar violates one's right to privacy & is therefore unconstitutional. -SC’s view: All matters pertaining to an individual do not qualify as being an inherent part of right to privacy.
(2/8) #AadharVerdict deciphered. -Concern 2: adhere is voluntary & govt cannot make it mandatory through I-T act. -SC’s view: Aadhaar mandatory for filing of income tax returns and allotment of PAN.

(1/8) #AadharVerdict deciphered. -Concern 1: Aadhaar biometrics could be misused for identity or financial thefts. -SC’s view: sufficient security measures to protect data, minimal biometric data collected with foolproof encryption.
